item.title: Report X-2024071016
item.description:
Report X-2024071016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-17T18:15:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging was wet and torn on all sides. Discoloration on the box is everywhere that the box is wet. Inside are 2 boxes. 1 is a 3 pack box of 121 fl oz plastic bottles of CloroxPro Germicidal Bleach Concentrate, and the other contains 1 bottle of the same product. Total of 4. All of the bottles have dents on the body and caused a crack where the contents leaked out of.

item.title: Report X-2024070991
item.description:
Report X-2024070991

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-17T18:15:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon inspection it was found that the package was wet from the top after being tipped over. It was discovered that the package contained 2 hazardous bottles (rapicidepa part a) and 2 nonhazardous bottles (rapicidepa part b). It was found that one of the part b bottles had a loose cap resulting in the leakage.

  • Description: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET, TORN AND RETAPED ON BOTTOM. TOO MUCH REHANDLE, WAS MISSORTED TO WOODBRIDGE, NJ WITH PACKAGE MARKED FOR WOODBRIDGE, CA. ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM VENTED CAP, VERY HOT WEATHER. SPILL MINOR, ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report E-2024070030
item.description:
Report E-2024070030

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: SOUTH GATE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-5ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that thirty (30) gallons of material was released due to four (4) crushed 5-gallon plastic pails. The damaged plastic pails were placed into one (1) 30-gallon and one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Clean Harbors personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used a granular absorbent to gather the spent material. The contractor placed the recovered spent absorbents into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum. One (1) 55-gallon poly drum was generated containing impacted pallet pieces. One (1) additional 15-gallon poly drum was generated for the contractor’s PPE. All waste generated from this response was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for J.B. Hunt contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they would tape-up, re-wrap, and sweep up the spill and place the contents into a 15-gallon poly drum for disposal.

  • Description: Manuel Contreras Operations Supervisor called safety to report a spill in trailer 84391 on a 5 gallon pail of UN1133, ADHESIVES, 3, PG II. Manuel stated he thinks the pail was crushed at the bottom by the back stop of the forklift while loading the pallet into the trailer. Manuel stated it looks to be around 8oz of the product has spilled onto the trailer floor.

  • Description: Exterior packaging is wet and torn on the underside of the box. Opened the box from the top and what was on the top side of the box is the underside of the bottles. These bottles are 2 qty of 2.5 gallon white plastic bottles of Noble Chemical Breaker 1, Liquid Soil Breaker. With the cap side at the bottom of the box, in reference to the orientation arrow of the box, the pressure of the weight led the liquid to spill with both bottles losing approximately 8 fl oz each.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD TORN, WET, CRUSHED AND LEAKING. PACKAGE DAMAGED IN TRANSIT, TOO MUCH WEIGHT ON PACKAGE AND INDADEQUATE BLOCK AND BRACE. NO MARKINGS INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS NOR USE OF ORIENTATION ARROWS. PREVIOUSLY DPR'D WITHOUT KNOWLEDGE THAT GOODS ARE REGULATED. SAFETY DATA SHEET CONFIRMS THAT GOODS ARE REGULATED. TWO BOTTLES CRUSHED, LEAKAGE FROM CAPS, ALL GOODS SOILED. SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS, PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024070178
item.description:
Report E-2024070178

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee brought a trailer to the unloading dock at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Azusa, CA and staged it for unloading. While transferring pallets containing drums of hazardous waste, one of the 5 gallon drums was noticed to have a small indentation towards the bottom that created a pinhole. This pinhole had material slowly dripping onto the pallet. Approximately a few drops came out from the pinhole. The liquid was cleaned up with an absorbent rag. The 5 gallon drum was overpacked into a new drum for shipment. The actual material leaking was mineral oil which was used to stabilize the lithium. These drums were palletized and some drums may have been sticking outside of the parameters of the pallet which may have hit the trailer walls during the offloading process.

item.title: Report E-2024070177
item.description:
Report E-2024070177

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was moving drums into a trailer utilizing a drum grabber/clamp at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Fremont, CA. The drum grabber/clamp gets a hold on the drum from the top and bottom portion of the drum lip. When picking up the next row of 55 gal metal drums, the employee tilted the mast back. Before driving forward, the employee noticed a liquid stream coming down on the side of one of the drums. Approximately 8 oz of the chemical was spilled and landed on the warehouse concrete floor. The spill did not enter any drains and was immediately cleaned up. The leaking drum was placed into a salvage container. There was no evidence of punctures or deficiencies to the drum itself.

item.title: Report X-2024070481
item.description:
Report X-2024070481

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: SAN BERNARDINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BURLINGTON NORTHERN RAILROAD HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/17/2024, the BNSF San Bernardino hub personnel reported Unit JBHU 262270 (Waybill Hazardous) as leaking a substance from the rear of the container that did reach the ground after unit was de ramped from a train. Unit was taken to the Hazmat Pit for safety. On the behalf of the shipper, approved contractor United Pumping was contacted and dispatched to complete inspection. Interior inspection revealed 15 supersacks in 2 rows throughout the container. Source of the leak was determined to be one supersack filled with pool chlorine granules in the rear of the unit. The cause for the Leak was determined to be less than a pound of pool chlorine leaked from the top of the supersack, contributing to the material leak. The granules mixed with the condensation in the unit creating a liquid which leaked from the rear of the container. Total quantity of leaked liquid was approximately 16 ounces of product. During the inspection a bullboard was located at the rear of the load as securement. Contractor United Pumping completed remediation of the unit and all affected areas. Spilled product was cleaned and disposed of.
